result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (6th) and Operating w/ PAC (6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • John A. Schoenstene was found guilty of OWI (6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waushara County Clerk of Circuit Court

superMiscConds.notes: Court orders the fines, costs, and restitution in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant is prohibited from going on the premises of any bars.

Defendant to maintain timely, uninterrupted payments as ordered in Waushara Co Case No. 05FA118.  Orders subject to modification in the future by further order of the Court. All payments are to be paid through the Wisconsin Support Collections Trust Fund (WISCTF), not through the Department of Corrections.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

supervisions.notes: Prior to re-licensing the defendant is to complete an OWI Assessment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Information for Defendants After Felony Conviction - Warning not to Possess Firearms
Character letters submitted on behalf of the defendant

Case called @ 2:59 p.m. Defendant John A. Schoenstene in court with attorney Bryan D Keberlein.  Defendant John A. Schoenstene in custody.  Scott C Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant bound over for trial. Information filed by DA Blader. Receipt admitted - Reading waived.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Ct 1 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Ct 2 - Dismissed outright. 14TR169, 14TR170 & 14TR171 - DRI.  Statement by the defendant. Court orders: 56 month term of imprisonment - 20 mos IC/36 mos ES - 95 days CFTS,  ES Conditions: $3000 fine inclusive of costs to be paid from 25% of inmate earnings, 36 mos DL revocation/36 mos IID, OWI Assessment,  Not be on the premises of any bars, Abs Sob, AODA, Maintain timely monthly child support payments as directed in 05FA118. Defendant is not eligible for CIP. Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 30, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Character letters from T.H., K.L. & D.Y
Status conference on March 24, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
Status conference on March 18, 2014 at 01:45 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 10CF-148 and 14CF-8 - Both Cases Called @ 1:25 PM: Defendant John A. Schoenstene in court with attorney Bryan Keberlein.   Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  14CF-8:  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Court entertains waiver of time limits for pre-lim hearing - 10 days.  Court accepts voluntary waiver of 10 day time limit.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for March 18, 2014 at 01:45 pm.
Initial appearance on February 11, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.  No operation of any motor vehicles whatsoever.  Defendant is prohibited from going on the premises of any bars.

Case called @ 1:05 p.m. Defendant John A. Schoenstene in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Bryan Keberlein.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. DA Blader requesting $3000 Cash Bond. Atty Keberlein requesting lower cash bond or signature bond. Court orders $3000 Cash Bond.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for February 11, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
